p: The CERES-Rice Plant Growth Module is process based and comes under the Grain Cereals-Rice compartment inside the DSSAT. This model emphasizes the effects of the weather, the management, and the soil properties on the crop performance [ 36]. The model was designed to predict the yield of crop varieties, the soil water regimes, and the nitrogen (N) level, considering alternative technologies and new crop sites as well [ 37â€“ 41]. Timsina and Humphreys [ 38] validated the output and mentioned that the CERES-Rice model has performed reasonably well in Asia and Australia. The performance of this model was evaluated using simulated and observed crop yield values at TNAU by various researchers.
